intro: Canthium zizyphoides, commonly known as the African hog peanut, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers followed by capsule fruits that contain kidney-shaped seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including savannas and woodland edges. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
